title: At least 30 dead, 100 injured, in clashes between armed groups in southern city of Sweida, say Syrian officials
description: Syria's interior ministry said that its forces will directly intervene to resolve the conflict, which is reported to involve Druze gunmen and Bedouin Sunni tribes.
content:
At least 30 people have been killed in the Syrian city of Sweida between local military groups and tribes, according to Syria's interior ministry.
Officials say initial figures suggest around 100 people have also been injured in the city, where the D... [2329 chars]

title: Bank of England prepared to cut rates if job market slows, says governor
description: Andrew Bailey tells the Times "I really do believe the path is downward" on interest rates.
content:
In the Times interview, Mr Bailey said the UK's economy was growing behind its potential, opening up "slack" that would help to bring down ­inflation.
The governor said there were consistent signs that businesses are "adjusting employment and hours" ... [1115 chars]

title: Met Office: Extreme weather the UK's new normal
description: The UK has a notably different climate compared with just a few decades ago, the Met Office says.
content:
Climate change is bringing more severe weather events like storms and flooding - and inevitably the country's changing climate is having an impact on the natural world, with some species suffering.

title: Viktor Orban's playbook is admired abroad but weakening at home
description: Hungarian Prime Minister Viktor Orban finds his power under threat, but not in the way one might expect.
content:
Hungarians have a popular saying: "Visszanyal a fagyi". Translation: "The ice-cream licks back." In other words, watch out, because what you enjoy devouring, might enjoy devouring you.
Hungarian Prime Minister Viktor Orban has assiduously attacked a ... [948 chars]
